topics.title: Introduction and Background
topics.summary: Tomer frames how rapidly job skills are changing and why builders must rethink how they work. Lenny introduces LinkedIn’s experiment with an AI-native way of building products.

topics.title: Sponsor Break
topics.summary: Sponsor messages from Vanta and Figma (Figma Make) about compliance automation and rapid prototyping in Figma.

topics.title: Why traditional product building became too complex
topics.summary: Tomer explains how product development at scale accumulates process and organizational complexity, leading to micro-specialization and slow shipping. He argues AI creates an opportunity to “collapse the stack” back toward craftsmanship.

topics.title: LinkedIn data on skill disruption and job churn
topics.summary: They unpack LinkedIn’s stats: by 2030, ~70% of skills needed for current jobs will change, with some roles seeing 90–95% impact. They also discuss how fast-growing jobs shift year to year, underscoring accelerating change.

topics.title: Full Stack Builder model: goals and builder traits
topics.summary: Tomer introduces the Full Stack Builder model: empowering people across functions to take ideas to market using human+AI workflows. He highlights the core human strengths to preserve—vision, empathy, communication, creativity, and especially judgment.

topics.title: Three pillars: platform, agents/tools, and culture
topics.summary: Tomer outlines what it takes for large companies to adopt this model: re-architecting platforms so AI can reason over them, building internal agents, and driving cultural change. He notes off-the-shelf tools rarely work without deep customization.

topics.title: Internal agents: trust, growth, research, and analytics
topics.summary: Tomer describes LinkedIn-specific agents (e.g., Trust agent for harm vectors, Growth agent for loops/funnels, Research agent for personas, Analyst agent for querying the graph). The key is encoding company context and expertise rather than generic AI.

topics.title: How agents are built and orchestrated
topics.summary: They discuss the stack behind building agents (Copilot/ChatGPT Enterprise plus heavy internal customization) and the need for orchestration across specialized agents. Tomer also notes tool fragmentation (different teams prefer different design tools) and the need to converge.

topics.title: Automation focus: idea-to-design vs code-to-launch
topics.summary: Tomer explains why they’re investing heavily in the early phases (idea-to-design) in addition to coding acceleration. He shares examples like maintenance agents fixing failed builds and QA automation, while expanding AI support for specs and product jams.

topics.title: Sponsor Break
topics.summary: Sponsor message from Miro about using AI in an innovation workspace to turn unstructured inputs into briefs, diagrams, and prototypes.

topics.title: Pilot status, metrics, and early outcomes
topics.summary: Tomer shares how they’re measuring impact (experiment volume × quality ÷ time) and what they’re seeing: hours saved weekly, better insight discussions, and growing appetite for access. The program hasn’t fully GA’d internally yet but is expanding via pods.

topics.title: How the pilot is run: pods and early adopters
topics.summary: They detail the rollout approach: a core team builds the FSB track while selected pods get access in exchange for feedback. Tomer gives examples of teams using tools to ship semantic search and designers beginning to submit PRs.

topics.title: Replacing APM with Associate Product Builder program
topics.summary: Tomer explains LinkedIn is ending its APM program and launching an Associate Product Builder program that trains new hires in coding, design, and PM skills. The training will also inform how they upskill the broader organization.

topics.title: Adoption reality: top performers, incentives, and change management
topics.summary: They discuss why top talent adopts AI fastest and why tools alone don’t drive behavior change. Tomer emphasizes incentives, examples, and structured change management—drawing parallels to LinkedIn’s desktop-to-mobile transition.

topics.title: Embedding AI expectations into evaluation and reviews
topics.summary: Tomer begins describing how they’re shifting expectations and assessment (including 360 reviews across functions) to reinforce full-stack behavior and AI fluency. This segment ends mid-thought as he starts to explain broader rollout into hiring and calibration.
